courses.course_description: Introduces primary techniques of painting.  Emphasis on conceptualization of visual perception (understanding how we see) and the creative processes (understanding how we create).  Sections either in oil or acrylic; contact instructor.  Expendable material fee required.
Theory, practice of painting in water color from still life, landscape, figure. Expendable materials fee required.
Continuation of ART_PNT 2500 with the addition of portrait painting. Expendable materials fee required.
Continuation of ART_PNT 2510. Theory and practice of painting in watercolor. Expendable materials fee required.
Advanced problems in oil and acrylic painting.  May be repeated to 15 hours maximum. Expendable materials fee required.
(cross-leveled with ART_PNT 7510). Advanced problems in watercolor. May repeat to 15 hours maximum. Expendable materials fee required.
Problems in Painting. Enrollment limited to students who have taken ART_PNT 4500.

courses.course_name: Graduate Painting: Studio Practice and Critique
courses.course_description: Advanced study. Emphasis on individual creative expression. May repeat to 15 hours maximum. Expendable materials fee required.
(cross-leveled with ART_PNT 4510). Advanced study in watercolor. Emphasis on individual creative expression. May repeat to 15 hours maximum. Expendable materials fee required.

courses.course_name: Graduate Painting: Advanced Studio Practice and Critique
courses.course_description: Continuation of ART_PNT 7500. Repeatable to 15 hours.
Continuation of ART_PNT 7510. Repeatable to 15 hours.
Contextualizing artwork in culture, history, and theory. Repeatable to 18 hours for credit.  Graded on A-F basis only.

Advanced independent studio practice including critical evaluation of student's creative work.  Individual study in painting is to be proposed by the student and approved by the instructor.  The student will meet on a regular basis with the instructor to review student progress.  May be repeated for credit. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: For students with strong preparation in Art; departmental consent; ART_PNT 7585
